project.projectDescription: A research group was interested in determining if the mean number of deaths in NYC are in any way related to race/ethnicity of the deceased person. A total of 1000 responses were recorded of and a subset of that data has been leveraged in this particular area.
project.dataDescription: The leading causes of death by sex and ethnicity in New York City in since 2007. Cause of death is derived from the NYC death certificate which is issued for every death that occurs in New York City.
project.researchQuestion: Our primary area of concern pertains to whether race/ethnicity plays a significant role in the decedents death. We hope to understand if there are larger number of deaths for different ethnicityâ€™s which would warrant additional research in to this particular subject matter.
project.conclusion:
From the above plots, and the F test, we have significance evidence at the alpha = 0.05, that there are at least two races with different number of mean deaths
Based on the pairwise test results, We can say that we do not have sufficient evidence that mean deaths are different between the following pair of races: Not Stated/Unknown - Asian and Pacific Islander Other Race/ Ethnicity - Asian and Pacific Islander White Non-Hispanic - Asian and Pacific Islander Other Race/ Ethnicity - Not Stated/Unknown White Non-Hispanic - Not Stated/Unknown White Non-Hispanic - Asian and Pacific Islander
And we can conclude for all other pairs that the mean deaths is different.s
